Some politicians in Israel are pushing for punishment not only for those who attack Israelis but punishment for their families as well.

The Israeli lawmakers want to make it so that the state would have the power to demolish the family home of the attacker, plus cut off the family's health insurance and unemployment benefits.
Critics say the proposals are racist and have far more to do with revenge than justice.
From Jerusalem, NPR's Eric Westervelt reports.
Hisham Abudaim(ph) today looks like a haunted man.

Four months later, Hisham had hoped the worst days might be behind him.
